subject: Does anyone have more fonts?
msgSnippet: Dear All, Lately I ve been tinkering away on the King Plus font, and in doing so I m teaching myself how to edit a font. When saving the font, I get messages
messageBody:
Dear All,

Lately I've been tinkering away on the King Plus font, and in doing so I'm teaching myself how to edit a font. When saving the font, I get messages warning that the font contains errors, mainly some self-intersecting glyphs and some "paths" not being created in the correct direction. These errors might account for some strange formatting glitches I'm having in some LibreOffice documents in which I've used the font.

I'm basically learning what I need to in order to fix these problems, before I move along and try my hand at designing new fonts. But I'd like to make sure I'm not reinventing the wheel. Does anyone have any other fonts available for us to use? I see that in addition to the King Plus font, we do also have a nicely-done Thoth font in the files section (without all those font errors). But for now I'd like to stick to King Plus, since I especially like the shapes of the letters.

This question came to mind recently when someone named Tim uploaded a nice PDF of The Call of Cthulhu: I noticed that it used another version of the King Plus font, with excellent kerning (character spacing). I wondered whether that font also had its errors resolved already. I tried contacting Tim directly. (Are you out there, Tim?)

I've started work on retracing existing characters without self-intersecting them. I'm using Fontforge, an open-source program with a couple of shortcomings: It likes to crash when you do certain things, such as moving a glyph. And it often makes curves into straight line segments when you don't want that, and it won't allow them to be changed back. It seems I have to add some extra points in order to approximate curves in some places.

I'll appreciate whatever information, leads, or tips you all can offer.

Be Well,

Scott
